ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PROC DBF <option(s)>;

Converts a dBASE file to SAS data set or a SAS data set to a dBASE file.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DB2=fileref|filename]      
      
Specifies the fileref or filename of a DBF file.

[Syntax: DB3=fileref|filename]      
      
Specifies the fileref or filename of a DBF file.

[Syntax: DB4=fileref|filename]      
      
Specifies the fileref or filename of a DBF file.

[Syntax: DB5=fileref|filename]      
      
Specifies the fileref or filename of a DBF file.

[Syntax: DATA=<libref.>member]      
      
Names the input SAS data set. Use this option if you are creating a DBF file
from a SAS data set. If you use the DATA= option, do not use the OUT= option.
If you omit the DATA= option, SAS software creates an output SAS data set
from the DBF file.

[Syntax: OUT=<libref.>member]      
      
names the SAS data set that is created to hold the converted data. Use this
option only if you are creating a SAS data set from a DBF file and you did not
specify the DATA= option.
